transcript:
a yard above the glow of the charcoal. Flakes of fall- 
ing snow were fluttering in that light. Tushin had not returned, the doctor had not come. He was alone now, except for a soldier who was sitting naked at the other side of the fire, warm- ing his thin yellow body. 
"Nobody wants me I" thought Rostov. "There is no one to help me or pity me. Yet I was once at home, strong, happy, and loved." He sighed and, doing so, groaned involuntar- ily. 
"Eh, is anything hurting you?" asked the sol- dier
